main event: A pulsating object was observed falling and disappearing in Ogden, Utah on 20 February 1964.
interesting points: The object was initially noted to emit a yellow-white light., The object appeared to be about the size of a twenty-five cent piece at arm's length., Reports came from multiple employees at the Defense Depot as well as local police., The object was observed for about three seconds before disappearing behind a ridge., The maneuverability of the object was not comparable to any known meteor.
witness description: employees of the Defense Depot and local police
